SourcedStatement: At one point, Mr. Altman, the chief executive, made a move to push out one of the board’s members because he thought a research paper she had co-written was critical of the company.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: chief executive
Justification: Mr. Altman, the chief executive, made a move to push out one of the board’s members because he thought a research paper she had co-written was critical of the company.

SourcedStatement: Another member, Ilya Sutskever, thought Mr. Altman was not always being honest when talking with the board.
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: OpenAI board member
Justification: Another member, Ilya Sutskever, thought Mr. Altman was not always being honest when talking with the board.

SourcedStatement: And some board members worried that Mr. Altman was too focused on expansion while they wanted to balance that growth with A.I. safety.
Name: board members
Title: null
Justification: some board members worried that Mr. Altman was too focused on expansion while they wanted to balance that growth with A.I. safety.

SourcedStatement: The decision stunned OpenAI’s employees and exposed board members to tough questions about their qualifications to manage such a high-profile company.
Name: OpenAI’s employees
Title: null
Justification: The decision stunned OpenAI’s employees and exposed board members to tough questions about their qualifications to manage such a high-profile company.

SourcedStatement: Mr. Sutskever and others critical of Mr. Altman were jettisoned from the board, whose members now include Bret Taylor, an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce, and Larry Summers, the former Treasury Department secretary.
Name: Bret Taylor
Title: early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce
Justification: Mr. Sutskever and others critical of Mr. Altman were jettisoned from the board, whose members now include Bret Taylor, an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce, and Larry Summers, the former Treasury Department secretary.

SourcedStatement: Mr. Sutskever and others critical of Mr. Altman were jettisoned from the board, whose members now include Bret Taylor, an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce, and Larry Summers, the former Treasury Department secretary.
Name: Larry Summers
Title: former Treasury Department secretary
Justification: Mr. Sutskever and others critical of Mr. Altman were jettisoned from the board, whose members now include Bret Taylor, an early Facebook officer and former co-chief executive of Salesforce, and Larry Summers, the former Treasury Department secretary.

SourcedStatement: The only holdover is Adam D’Angelo, chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora.
Name: Adam D’Angelo
Title: chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora
Justification: The only holdover is Adam D’Angelo, chief executive of the question-and-answer site, Quora.

SourcedStatement: Nearly all of OpenAI’s 800 employees had threatened to follow Mr. Altman to Microsoft, which asked him to lead an A.I. lab with Greg Brockman, who quit his roles as OpenAI’s president and board chairman in solidarity with Mr. Altman.
Name: OpenAI’s 800 employees
Title: null
Justification: Nearly all of OpenAI’s 800 employees had threatened to follow Mr. Altman to Microsoft, which asked him to lead an A.I. lab with Greg Brockman, who quit his roles as OpenAI’s president and board chairman in solidarity with Mr. Altman.

SourcedStatement: The board had told Mr. Brockman that he would no longer be OpenAI’s chairman but invited him to stay on at the company — though he was not invited to the meeting where the decision was made to push him off the board and Mr. Altman out of the company.
Name: Greg Brockman
Title: OpenAI’s president and board chairman
Justification: The board had told Mr. Brockman that he would no longer be OpenAI’s chairman but invited him to stay on at the company — though he was not invited to the meeting where the decision was made to push him off the board and Mr. Altman out of the company.

SourcedStatement: In 2015, Mr. Altman teamed with Elon Musk and others, including Mr. Sutskever, to create a nonprofit to build A.I. that was safe and beneficial to humanity.
Name: Elon Musk
Title: null
Justification: In 2015, Mr. Altman teamed with Elon Musk and others, including Mr. Sutskever, to create a nonprofit to build A.I. that was safe and beneficial to humanity.

SourcedStatement: After Mr. Musk left in 2018, they created a for-profit subsidiary that began raising billions of dollars from investors, including $1 billion from Microsoft.
Name: Microsoft
Title: null
Justification: After Mr. Musk left in 2018, they created a for-profit subsidiary that began raising billions of dollars from investors, including $1 billion from Microsoft.

SourcedStatement: Among the tensions leading up to Mr. Altman’s ouster and quick return involved his conflict with Helen Toner, a board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Justification: Among the tensions leading up to Mr. Altman’s ouster and quick return involved his conflict with Helen Toner, a board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology.

SourcedStatement: A few weeks before Mr. Altman’s firing, he met with Ms. Toner to discuss a paper she had co-written for the Georgetown center.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Justification: A few weeks before Mr. Altman’s firing, he met with Ms. Toner to discuss a paper she had co-written for the Georgetown center.

SourcedStatement: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI’s efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI’s biggest rival, according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.
Name: email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues
Title: null
Justification: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI’s efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI’s biggest rival, according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times.

SourcedStatement: In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.
Name: email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues
Title: null
Justification: In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.

SourcedStatement: Ms. Toner defended it as an academic paper that analyzed the challenges that the public faces when trying to understand the intentions of the countries and companies developing A.I.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: board member and a director of strategy at Georgetown University’s Center for Security and Emerging Technology
Justification: Ms. Toner defended it as an academic paper that analyzed the challenges that the public faces when trying to understand the intentions of the countries and companies developing A.I.

SourcedStatement: But shortly after those discussions, Mr. Sutskever did the unexpected: He sided with board members to oust Mr. Altman, according to two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.
Name: two people familiar with the board’s deliberations
Title: null
Justification: But shortly after those discussions, Mr. Sutskever did the unexpected: He sided with board members to oust Mr. Altman, according to two people familiar with the board’s deliberations.

SourcedStatement: The statement he read to Mr. Altman said that Mr. Altman was being fired because he wasn’t “consistently candid in his communications with the board.”
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: OpenAI board member
Justification: The statement he read to Mr. Altman said that Mr. Altman was being fired because he wasn’t “consistently candid in his communications with the board.”

SourcedStatement: Mr. Sutskever’s frustration with Mr. Altman echoed what had happened in 2021 when another senior A.I. scientist left OpenAI to form Anthropic.
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: OpenAI board member
Justification: Mr. Sutskever’s frustration with Mr. Altman echoed what had happened in 2021 when another senior A.I. scientist left OpenAI to form Anthropic.

SourcedStatement: That scientist and other researchers went to the board to try to push Mr. Altman out.
Name: That scientist and other researchers
Title: null
Justification: That scientist and other researchers went to the board to try to push Mr. Altman out.

SourcedStatement: After they failed, they gave up and departed, according to three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out.
Name: three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out
Title: null
Justification: After they failed, they gave up and departed, according to three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out.

SourcedStatement: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,” an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said.
Name: Sally Aldous
Title: Anthropic spokeswoman
Justification: “After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,” an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said.

SourcedStatement: In a second statement, Anthropic added that there was “no attempt to ‘oust’ Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.”
Name: Anthropic
Title: null
Justification: In a second statement, Anthropic added that there was “no attempt to ‘oust’ Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.”

SourcedStatement: This year, it disagreed over how to replace three departing directors: Reid Hoffman, the LinkedIn founder and a Microsoft board member; Shivon Zilis, director of operations at Neuralink, a company started by Mr. Musk to implant computer chips in people’s brains; and Will Hurd, a former Republican congressman from Texas.
Name: Reid Hoffman
Title: LinkedIn founder and a Microsoft board member
Justification: This year, it disagreed over how to replace three departing directors: Reid Hoffman, the LinkedIn founder and a Microsoft board member; Shivon Zilis, director of operations at Neuralink, a company started by Mr. Musk to implant computer chips in people’s brains; and Will Hurd, a former Republican congressman from Texas.

Title: OpenAI’s chief strategy officer
Justification: During the call, Jason Kwon, OpenAI’s chief strategy officer, said the board was endangering the future of the company by pushing out Mr. Altman.

Justification: The board’s mission was to ensure that the company creates artificial intelligence that “benefits all of humanity,” and if the company was destroyed, she said, that could be consistent with its mission.
